revised_title: Enhancing the Magnetisation Limit of Iron
tldr: The author investigates the magnetisation limit of iron using various lengths of annealed charcoal-iron wire and finds that the magnetisation limit increases with the length of the wire up to 1 inch, beyond which no higher degree of magnetisation was obtained. The magnetisation limit of iron is determined to be 422 lbs. per sq. inch, or 29.67 kilos per sq. cm.
